intro: Chromolaena thurnii, commonly known as the African feverfew, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dark green, hairy leaves and clusters of small, yellow-orange flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas due to its adaptability. It has a fibrous root system and can grow up to 1.5 meters tall, making it a conspicuous presence in its native environment. Chromolaena thurnii is also known for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in treating various ailments.
